column4: I have an ssh server and some network shares setup on my desktop. i want to leave it on all the time but i dont want to waste that much power. i consider WoL but my desktop only has connection via wireless. what options do i have to make the shares and server available and save as much power as possible?
wireless network cards almost never support wake-on-lan, the best solution I can think of is to connect your desktop with a lan cable
its impossible to connect to LAN, since my cable modem/router is in an odd spot in another room
I see, then you could buy a wifi card that does support Wol (search google - realtek for example)  or some wireless-to-wired bridge (search google, I don't know if this even exists)
